review: Bist du dir sicher, dass du schon gehen willst?

I PREFER HEROES OF THE STORM RELEASE ON STEAM!!!!!!! 

WHO'S WITH ME?

Honestly how can two companies this large both point fingers at one another for the blame i bought the invasion dlc and steam support sent me to blizzard and blizzard sent me to steam someone take responsibility for it because id like to play it (im already paying for something blizzard promised for free when the game was originally) SMH

I've played OW since the first months of its original release. It was my favorite game for years. I'm so saddened to see it be degraded to a battle pass scam. I'm showing this game and its shop structure to my 11 yr old nephew to teach about how developers and greedy companies take advantage of their players and their wallets. Truly despicable what this game has come to. It could have been so different and remained one of the best games around. Putting heroes in the battle pass is the lowest of the low.
Great game that gets regular updates (unlike TF2)!
never have to open battlenet ever again

that look like shit from a butt
Overwatch is one of my favorite first-person shooters ever, but the microtransations in the "sequel" are abysmal.

Blizzard wasted everyone's time building some sort of big IP, only to squander it.
You saw every controversy imaginable. Through every nerf, buff, rework-over-rework,
and an otherwise restructuring of your game, and yet you spun in circles for SIX YEARS.
Now I get to say it. [b]You failed, Blizzard.[/b]
I'm sorry for many of your staff, who dealt with bad management and bad actors - and still stuck around to make this.
I don't want to play your game. I've already sunk hundreds of hours in,
only to get a "thanks for playing" and a unceremonious end of an era, and all the memories that came with it.

This Team Fortress 2 update is a massive step backward for the franchise, a disappointing departure from the qualities that once made it shine. The game initially boasted a diverse and charismatic cast of 9 classes, each brimming with personality and charm. However, Valve's recent decision to prioritize performative diversity, resulting in the addition of 37 seemingly one-dimensional characters, has raised concerns. This move feels more like a hasty attempt to cater to certain social trends and appease Twitter, now simply referred to as 'X'.

My profound disappointment doesn't stop at the casting choices. The removal of the beloved Mann vs. Machine (MVM) mode and the cancellation of other player-versus-environment (PVE) content is a bitter pill to swallow. Instead, players are offered story missions for a steep price of $15, delivering a paltry hour of gameplay at best. The lackluster execution of these missions, featuring haphazardly designed adversaries that seem to do little more than rush at players and meet their demise, further adds to the letdown.

One particularly perplexing decision was the elimination of the 12v12 format, ostensibly due to concerns about an overabundance of engineers in matches. This has been replaced by a lackluster 5v5 setup coupled with a 'Role Queue' system, significantly curtailing the potential for imaginative team compositions and strategic diversity. The frustrating part is that even classic classes like the engineer have seemingly fallen victim to the pressures of conforming to modern-day trends of performative diversity.

In conclusion, this update has veered away from the core essence of what made Team Fortress 2 a beloved title, trading its unique and captivating gameplay elements for what appears to be an attempt at superficial inclusivity. The result is a disappointing regression that falls short of the franchise's once illustrious reputation.

lying developers that spend all of their money on celebrity advertisement instead of making the game good. new broken promises every year. toxic players that will get you banned if you respond to them with the same energy. horrendous matchmaker. skins are 5x overpriced. charms cost more than a real version of them would. apparel is overpriced, outdated, and weak. this game is often called a "passion project" but every time they update it its solely to make more money off of. after putting 1200+ hours in game and peaking gm and top300 i have only been disappointed. overwatch 1  which people paid $60 for was completely removed from the universe including a player slot, only for them to start charging for things that were free from since removed lootboxes. lootboxes which gave incentive to play the game which i no longer have. school leagues around me are dropping the game too which genuinely makes it so theres no reason for me to care about playing. new characters are overbuffed and can do anything. supports control the game and have far too much utility. the porn is immaculate though highly recommend the reddit, this game made me ***

Got the game Day 1 and loved it then. Hated it a few years later. It's fallen so far, it's amazing.

-Can't play as all the heroes without unlocking, so as another reviewer said, the competitive integrity of the game is lost.
-Bastion's tank mode and many other abilities still removed completely from the game with no trace.
-No artwork tab because Blizzard hates you for liking their characters.
-Still have to go through Battle.net to play. Not having to was the main reason I bothered installing.
-Still no modding whatsoever. Eat sh*t.
-The other problems you already know about.

Why'd you bother, Blizzard? Disable reviews while you can.
